subject: Relationships
subcategory: Famous Love Stories That Changed History
title: Dante and Beatrice: Love That Created Literature
description: A short lesson to help you apply Dante and Beatrice: Love That Created Literature.

hook.text: He saw her twice. They never spoke. She died young. He wrote the greatest poem in Western literature to honor her.

buildup.text: Dante Alighieri first saw Beatrice Portinari when both were nine. He was captivated for the rest of his life.

discovery.text: Beatrice married another man. Dante married another woman. They barely interacted. Yet she became his ultimate muse.

twist.text: In 'The Divine Comedy,' Beatrice guides Dante through Paradise. She became a symbol of divine love and salvation.

climax.text: Dante proved love doesn't require possession. His unrequited devotion produced literature that defined a civilization.

punchline.text: Dante met Beatrice twice. The longing produced Western literature's finest poem.

quiz.question: What role does Beatrice play in 'The Divine Comedy'?
